directions: In a large fry pan over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the beef, season with salt and pepper, and cook, stirring to break up any clumps, until browned, about 8 minutes. Add the barbecue sauce, reduce the heat to low and cook until the meat is well coated and the sauce is heated through, about 5 minutes more.
Lightly toast the rolls. Place the open rolls on individual plates. Spoon the beef on the bottom half of each roll, cover with the top half and serve immediately. Serves 4.
Adapted from Williams-Sonoma Food Made Fast Series,
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
4 crusty sandwich rolls, cut in half
title: Barbecued Beef Sandwiches
